caption: Figure 2: MHSA.
description: This figure shows the architecture of the Multi-Head Self-Attention (MHSA) mechanism used in the Transformer model.  The input  is linearly projected into three matrices: Query (Q), Key (K), and Value (V).  The dot product of Q and K is computed, followed by a softmax function to generate attention weights. These weights are then used in a dot product with V to produce the output, which is further linearly projected. This process is repeated for multiple heads (H), and the outputs from each head are concatenated.
